page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Other highlights in Claxton history given in the Paston Letters are as follows: 1450:St.George's Day.The King(Henry VI) had been expected at Norwich or Claxton. 1452:Some gentleman wrote to the sheriff enquiring whether the Duke of Norfolk was coming to Norwich or Claxton. 1465:The Duke of Suffolk and both Duchessys' came to spend the night at Claxton on their way from Framlingham Castle. 1466: Paston had a suit before the Duke of Norfolk,respecting the aggressions of the Duke of Suffolk,and he writes the former to ask whether he shall come before "his highness" at Norwich or Claxton.
